The main holding in Germany is about 25-30 %_of_the_Allge- meine Elektrizitäts Gesellschaft (capital 120,000,000 RM ) , the larg- est German electrical concern. It is believed however , that since the financial reorganization of the AEG during the depression the participating interest of General Electric has considerably increased. Through the German AEG, the General Electric has acquired indirect control over a very large number of German concerns in diversified fields of insdurty and communication. The International General Electric Company holds 20% of the stock of the great Dutch electrical firm, N. V. Philips, which has important holdings in Germany.; In 1930 the International General Electric Company bought a major share of a flotation of 35,000 nonvoting participating debentures of Siemens & Halske; International General Electric has patent exchange contracts with Siemens and Halske and with Julius Pintsch A. G.

The WESTINGHOUSE ELECTRIC INTERNATIONAL Co. has a patent agreement with the Siemens -Schuckertwerke A. G., which is controlled by Siemens & Halske . The agreement , which ran from October 17, 1924-1934 , and was renewed in 1934, provided that the American concern would get exclusive rights in the United States and Canada, while the German firm got similar rights in Germany, Austria , Hungary , Danzig , Latvia , Lithuania , and Estonia . All the rest of the world except Japan and territory given exclusively to Metropol- itan - Vickers in contract with Westinghouse was made non ex- clusive territory.

US Company: Pan American Foreign Corporation (Controlled by Standard Oil Co. [N. J.])
Description: The STANDARD OIL CO . OF INDIANA owns the Pan-American Foreign Corporation , which owns the Ebano Asphaltwerke A. G., capital 9,000,000 R.M.
The Tide Water Associated Oil Co. owns 93.5% of the Hamburg -Amerikanische Mineralölgesellschaft m.b.H. , capital 2,500,000 RM.

German subsidiary: American Express Company mit Beschrankter Haftung
Description: The AMERICAN EXPRESS CO. M. B. H. ( 500,000 RM ) of Germany is owned by the American Express Co.Inc. The stock of this concern is owned 99.97 % by the American Express Company , 98% of whose stock is held by the Amerex Holding Co. This last concern by is owned the Chase National Bank and its shareholders .

The AKU—Algemeene Kunstzijde Unie N. V., Arnhem, Holland owns  almost 100 % of the Vereinigte Glanzstoff A.G.; Vereinigte; Glanzstoff owns a majority of the stock of the North American Rayon Corporation , Tennessee , capital $3,500,000 , to which company it has granted exclusive rights to certain artificial silk patents and processes .
The FISK RUBBER Co. owns the Fisk Tyre Co , m.b.H. , capital 100,000 RM.

The GENERAL AMERICAN TRANSPORTATION CORPORATION owns almost half of the Allgemeine Transportmittel Finanzierungs A. G. (4,000,000 RM ) . Max Epstein , Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General American Transportation Corporation , also sits on the Board of the German firm .
The GILLETTE SAFETY RAZOR Co. owns 67 % of the Roth Buchner G.m.b.H., capital 2,860,000 RM., and also owns the Gillette Safety Razor Co. Gm.b.H.

Description: The B. F. GOODRICH RUBBER Co. , Akron , Ohio owns 100 % the International B. F. Goodrich Corporation , which owns the Deutsche Goodrich Compagnie G.m.b.II. ( 100,000 RM ) . In addition , the B. F. Goodrich Rubber Co. has a working agreement with the Continale Cautchoucgesellschaft .

US firm (as in book): American Ship and Commerce Corporation (W. A. Harriman)
Description: The AMERICAN SHIP AND COMMERCE CORPORATION (W. A. Harriman ) owned 10,000,000 RM . of non-voting shares in the Hamburg- Amerika Linie, capital 161,370,200 RM . Due to repeated reorganiza- tions of the latter, the present holdings cannot be accurately gauged .
JOHNSON & SON , St. Louis , owns the Deutsche Johnson A. G. (500,000 RM) .

Description: JULIUS KAYSER & Co. owns the Kayser Textile G.m.b.H.

German subsidiary: Deutsche Libbey-Owens Gesellschaft für machinelle Glasherstellung A.G.
Affiliated German firm (as in book): Deutsche Libbey -Owens Gesellschaft für machinelle Glasherstellung A. G.
Description: The LIBBEY-OWENS-FORD GLASS Co. owns the Cie. Internationale pour la fabrication mecanique du verre , Belgium . Together with this subsidiary , the Libbey -Owens -Ford Glass Co. owns the Deutsche Libbey -Owens Gesellschaft für machinelle Glasherstellung A. G., capital 11,500,000 RM . Charles Schmettau , Vice - President of Libbey- Owens-Ford, sits on the Board of Directors of Deutsche Libbey- Owens . Deutsche Libbey - Owens holds a minority interest in the Deutsche Tafelglas A. G. ( 6.000.000 RM ) , a consortium of leading German producers of glass .

The NORTON COMPANY (abrasives ) owns the Deutsche Norton G.m.b.H. , capital 1,000,000 RM .
The PREUSSISCHE Bergwerks- UND HUTTEN GESELLSCHAFT owns 100 % the Amber Mines Inc. , capital $ 25,000 .

The F. W. WOOLWORTH Co. owns outright the F. W. Woolworth Co. G.m.b.H. , capital 23,609.000 RM. There are at present 82 Wool- worth stores in Germany. In the past five years, the capital of F. W. Woolworth G.m.b.H. has been increased from 7.500.000 RM to 33.- 000,000 RM , largely as a result of the impossibility of withdrawing profits from Germany. The profit in 1938 was $2,030,000 ; in 1937 $1,750,000 .
